[!\[\]()](https://www.linkedin.com/in/satyanadella?trk=public_post_feed-actor-image)

[Satya Nadella](https://www.linkedin.com/in/satyanadella?trk=public_post_feed-actor-name)

Satya Nadella is an Influencer

1h

- [Report this post](/uas/login?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Fposts%2Fsatyanadella_super-excited-about-gpt-52-from-our-partners-activity-7404949433819463680-VyMD&trk=public_post_ellipsis-menu-semaphore-sign-in-redirect&guestReportContentType=POST&_f=guest-reporting)

Super excited about GPT-5.2 from our partners at OpenAI. Making it natively part of the Microsoft tools people use every day along with your work data helps all the new model capabilities shine.

The pace of progress continues to accelerate. GPT‚Äë5.2 brings together GPT-5.2 Thinking‚Äîbuilt for solving harder problems, long-context reasoning, coding, spreadsheets, and presentations; and GPT-5.2 Instant‚Äîan efficient model for everyday writing, translation, and skill-building.

‚Ä¢ GPT-5.2 with Work IQ is great for unlocking insights, market research, and strategic planning ‚Äîreasoning across your meetings, emails, and docs. Starting today, you can select GPT-5.2 in the model picker in M365 Copilot.

‚Ä¢ In GitHub Copilot, GPT-5.2 is a fantastic multi-purpose model, especially when it comes to long-context and reasoning when coding or investigating a complex code base. Also available today.

‚Ä¢ We‚Äôre also bringing GPT-5.2 models to Microsoft Foundry and Copilot Studio, and starting rollout in our Copilot consumer experience.

Ultimately, for us this is all about model choice for all of our customers and with auto, you can rely on Copilot to pick the right model for the job at hand. I‚Äôm looking forward to what customers are able to achieve with this new capability.

1h

- [Report this comment](/uas/login?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Fposts%2Fsatyanadella_super-excited-about-gpt-52-from-our-partners-activity-7404949433819463680-VyMD&trk=public_post_comment_ellipsis-menu-semaphore-sign-in-redirect&guestReportContentType=COMMENT&_f=guest-reporting)

Model choice is powerful, but auto-selection hides the reasoning. When Copilot picks GPT-5.2 Thinking over Instant for your spreadsheet, what exists to show you why? Which data did it touch, what logic drove the choice, what confidence level? Work data is sensitive. "Auto" means nothing if users can't audit it. That's the gap between model choice and model accountability. Can users see the full decision path for every model selection?

Massive step forward.

At Crossroads Technologies, we‚Äôre already seeing how GPT-5.2‚Äôs long-context reasoning and Work IQ reshape enterprise operations when paired with the Microsoft stack.

The biggest unlock isn‚Äôt just model performance‚Äîit's the ability to run decision frameworks, market analysis, and workflow automation natively inside the tools operators already live in.

This is exactly the kind of foundation we build on: Microsoft Fabric + M365 Copilot + Azure agents ‚Üí fully instrumented, AI-driven operations.

Excited to push the limits of what‚Äôs possible with this release.

GPT‚Äë5.2 shows that progress isn‚Äôt just acceleration ‚Äî it‚Äôs cognition differentiated. Thinking vs Instant, Work IQ vs Copilot: models become modes of reasoning, not just engines of output. MarCognity‚ÄëAI extends this: every mode is audited, reflected, and evolved toward autonomy that serves humanity. Choice + metacognition = trust that scales across contexts and frontiers.

The pace of innovation here is remarkable. GPT-5.2 shows how fast the industry is moving from experimental AI to tools that solve real problems and deliver real results. The blend of deeper reasoning, long-context understanding, and everyday efficiency is exactly what teams need to make decisions faster, uncover insights, and turn scattered information into clarity.

What matters most is that this isn‚Äôt just ‚Äúnew tech‚Äù ‚Äî it‚Äôs practical capability. When models like GPT-5.2 integrate directly into workflows across M365 and GitHub, they help people think better, work smarter, and execute with precision. This acceleration is necessary for a world where organizations must adapt quickly, scale talent, and unlock value from their data. Exciting direction.

The only reason people are using Microsoft 365 Copilot, is because it's all their organization provides. Most that I know, use their own personal subscription to ChatGPT, Claude, or Gemini, rather than be stuck with Copilot.

New models being available in GitHub is useful, but as before, the best way to access GPT-5.2 is through ChatGPT or Codex.

Hoping Microsoft starts takings AI seriously, dumps Copilot, and builds something not completely terrible.

Maybe you know someone that can make that happen.
